title: The rights you might not realize you have - Shannon Odell

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason behind young plaintiffs suing their governments worldwide?

options.label: C
options.text: To tackle climate change and its effects on their future.

multiple-choice.question: Which document, adopted in 1948, describes the inherent freedoms that belong to all people?

options.label: A
options.text: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR).

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a binding international treaty that all countries must follow.

options.label: B
options.text: It establishes rights like freedom of thought, political liberties, and socioeconomic and cultural rights.

options.label: C
options.text: It focuses primarily on environmental protection.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a national document that only applies to certain countries.

multiple-choice.question: What right is not explicitly mentioned in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)?

options.label: A
options.text: The right to freedom of thought.

options.label: B
options.text: The right to a healthy environment.

multiple-choice.question: Which countries were among the first to incorporate the right to a healthy environment into their constitutions?

options.label: B
options.text: Countries in the Global South, often influenced by Indigenous laws and worldviews.

multiple-choice.question: What is the predicted outcome if rapid and significant change is not made to address climate change?

options.label: A
options.text: The planet will experience a slight increase in temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: The planet is at risk of mass extinction, which could wipe out a quarter of the world's biodiversity by 2100.

options.label: C
options.text: The planet will experience more frequent natural disasters.

options.label: D
options.text: The planet will experience a decrease in pollution.

multiple-choice.question: How many countries and jurisdictions have enshrined the right to a healthy environment into national legislation?
What was the outcome of the Colombian Supreme Court case in 2018?

options.label: A
options.text: The court ruled in favor of the government.

options.label: B
options.text: The court ruled in favor of the young plaintiffs, finding that the government was legally obliged to reduce deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions.

multiple-choice.question: How many human rights-based environmental cases have been filed across the globe as of the summer of 2023?
What was the outcome of the UN General Assembly's decision in 2022 regarding human rights and the environment?

options.label: A
options.text: The assembly rejected the proposal to recognize the right to a clean, healthy, and sustainable environment.

options.label: C
options.text: The assembly recognized the right to a clean, healthy, and sustainable environment.

options.label: D
options.text: The assembly amended the Universal Declaration of Human Rights to include environmental rights.
